reviews.positive_feedback: This is the *perfect* place to stay in Montanita, especially if you're a surfer. The location is ideal -- far enough from the downtown that it's peaceful and quiet, yet close enough that you can still go out to party if you want. It's located directly in front of the main surf spot, with a bar/restaurant overlooking the break. It's a good surf spot for both beginners and experienced surfers. Rooms are clean and comfortable with a lovely shared terrace, and the pool and hot tub and general ambience are all great. The GM Chincho, receptionist Lizbeth, bartender Cristhian, and all the staff were extremely friendly, helpful, and easy-going -- they were constantly making sure I had everything I needed. Chincho also has a great selection of surfboards for rent at reasonable prices. There are several good restaurants within walking distance.  Long story short, this is the place you want to be.  I plan to return with friends and rent out the whole house.

reviews.negative_feedback: If you're looking for a party hostel or a place to meet other travellers, this isn't the open-concept environment to do so, although there is a beautiful yard and patio at the back for a hangout. I noticed that most guests mostly just came here to rest and had their own plans. Which I didn't mind, this was perfect for me, as I had my own plans and family and friends to meet up with.
reviews.positive_feedback: Jose was an exceptional desk host. Accommodations and flexibility were easily made for me to stay an extra night and check out and leave my baggage in my room later until I needed to leave in the evening. Excellent communication and help to provide information on things to do in Montanita as well as help to plan for a Galapagos tour. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful if I needed anything. Breakfast options could of varied a bit more, as I was lactose intolerant and it breakfast was mostly just granola and yogurt. But other than that, this place is very clean and quiet and not even a 1 minute walk from the beach and 3 minute walk from the town. I would definitely be staying here again on my next trip.

reviews.title: I was blocked to prevent me writing a negative review
reviews.date: Fecha del comentario: 5 de diciembre de 2022
reviews.negative_feedback:
Upon arrival, I experienced a little shock from the ugly, dark and tiny room with a view of the wall - see photos. The view of the (gray) sea and (gray) sky was only from the upper terrace, where you could only climb up a very steep wooden staircase. Watch out for injuries when you climb down!

Everything was shabby in the hostel. I understand that living in Switzerland (where the owner lives) is expensive (the most expensive in Europe), so there is no money left for hostel renovations, but on the other hand, paint and varnish are cheap in Ecuador.

In the evening, I noticed that my sheet (and also the blanket) were dirty. I asked the receptionist for a change. He objected that the sheet was clean, there were "only" stains on it. But he changed it for me. The next morning he didn't even answer my greeting. I had to greet him 3 times before he answered me angrily. He acted angry (only towards me) for the next few days. So don't believe it when the owner here responds to every criticism that if the guests didn't like something, they should have complained on the site, because everything could be solved. Yes, you can complain on the site, and then you can "enjoy" unpleasant treatment from the local staff (and/or blocking from the remote owner from writing a negative review).

I have experienced many hostels in different countries, so I can compare that this one was the 2nd worst.
reviews.positive_feedback:
You can read this review only because I communicated with Booking.com for several months and provided evidence that I was actually staying at the hostel. I didn't like it so much in the hostel that I decided that rather than ruining my vacation, I'd rather let the owner payment for 4 nights and I left after 2 nights. However, the owner used a trick so I couldn't write a review since he updated my status to 'no show' - it means that I didn't arrive. As a result, I couldn't even post photos. I finally managed to solve this scam. I hereby salute the owner - it didn't work out. And you all can now enjoy real photos from the hostel.

The photos of the hostel are full of sunshine. Forget about it. The sun is there only if you come between December and February. Otherwise, for 9 months you will see gray sky, gray beach sand and gray (and cold) sea. As another guest explained to me, if I want to enjoy a sunny beach, I have to go to nearby Mancora (northern Peru).

I should have been put off by the initial misunderstanding during the reservation, but in the end it became clear that I did not ask for an early check-in or an extra standard. Unfortunately, it calmed me down.
